```suggestion
lemma isPerfectMatching_induce_supp_isMatching {M : Subgraph G} (h : M.IsPerfectMatching)
```
This is a pretty bad idea. You should add the necessary fintype assumptions by hand. Otherwise you will have a hard time applying your lemmas
Gotcha, that makes sense. Removed it:)

```suggestion
lemma even_card_of_isPerfectMatching {M : Subgraph G} (c : ConnectedComponent G)
```

```suggestion
    (hM : M.IsPerfectMatching) : Even (Fintype.card c.supp) := by
```

```suggestion

end Finite
end ConnectedComponent
```

```suggestion
      refine âŸ¨by trivial, Set.not_mem_of_mem_diff hw, by trivial, v'.prop.2, ?_âŸ©
      rw [Subgraph.top_adj]
      rw [hv'.2]
      exact adj_symm G hadj
```

```suggestion
    refine âŸ¨?_, rflâŸ©
    rw [â† (ConnectedComponent.mem_supp_iff _ _).mp hv'.1]
    apply ConnectedComponent.connectedComponentMk_eq_of_adj
```
and unindent the rest

You over-indented this, and we don't spaces around pointy brackets
```suggestion
  rw [Set.mem_image]
  obtain âŸ¨v' , hv'âŸ© := hv
```
Do you really need this as as separate definition? I think it will be more trouble maintaining than it is worth
I'm not sure, so I deferred to you and removed it

I don't think you need this here?
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
I generalised your lemma below to this lemma, which seems worth having.
You should not rewrite on a goal of the form `âŠ¢ Decidable _` as `rw`/`simp` will introduce a `Eq.rec` term that can't be reduced by the kernel.
That kind of makes sense to me, do you happen to know any resource where I can learn about these kind of details, or is it just a matter of experience?
I'm afraid it's part of the unwritten community knowledge ðŸ˜¬
`lemma : easy_corollary_of_something_before := by simpa using something_before` is a very good idiom to learn

```suggestion
  Quot.recOn c f fun u v r => r.elim_path fun p => h u v p p.2
```

```suggestion
* Hall's Marriage Theorem (see Combinatorics.Hall.Basic)
```
I *think* this is the correct syntax for the linkifier to work

`SetLike` already provides the `Mem` instance for your convenience
```suggestion
lemma mem_supp_of_adj {H : Subgraph G} {c : ConnectedComponent H.coe}
    (hv : v âˆˆ c.supp) (hw : w âˆˆ H.verts)
    (hadj : H.Adj v w) : w âˆˆ c.supp := by
  rw [â† SetLike.mem_coe, Set.mem_image]
```
I think the thing is that `c.supp : Set â†‘H.verts`, with your changes I get `failed to synthesize instance Membership ?m.219094 (Set â†‘H.verts)`, is there a cleaner way to resolve this?

Oh I see. `(c.supp : Set V)` inserts the coercion `Set â†‘H.verts â†’ Set V` (which is internal and not for use in mathlib). You should write that coercion explicitly instead by doing `v âˆˆ (â†‘) '' c.supp`. Well actually `v âˆˆ (â†‘) '' c` (or `v âˆˆ (â†‘) '' (c : Set H.verts)` as `SetLike.coe` should be favored over `supp`
Done:) Are these rules just for consistency or is there a technical reason to favour `SetLike.coe`?

The technical reason is that otherwise people who try using your lemmas will have to deal with a function that appears nowhere else in mathlib, rather than the composition of two functions that each appear many times

```suggestion
```
Shouldn't this move to `Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity`?
Moved:)

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ© := hv
```

FYI you can use `..` to avoid several `_`
```suggestion
  rw [â† (ConnectedComponent.mem_supp_iff ..).mp hv'.1]
```

```suggestion
      refine âŸ¨âŸ¨âŸ¨âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ©, hv, rflâŸ©, ?_, hw.1âŸ©, fun _ hy â†¦ hw.2 _ hy.2.2âŸ©
```
